title: Sales: Product Knowledge
description: Learn about golf cart features, specifications, customization options, and how to effectively communicate value to customers.

steps.title: Golf Cart Product Lines
steps.instructions:
Welcome to the Sales Product Knowledge training! In this module, you'll learn about our complete golf cart lineup, including:

• Standard Electric Carts
• Premium Electric Carts
• Utility Vehicles
• Custom Builds

Understanding the differences between models will help you match customers with the right cart for their needs.
commonMistakes: Not asking about the customer's primary use case
Focusing only on price instead of value
Forgetting to mention warranty and service options
steps.whyItMatters: Customers trust salespeople who understand the product. Your knowledge helps them make confident purchasing decisions.

steps.title: Electric vs Gas: Key Differences
steps.instructions:
Understanding the differences between electric and gas carts is essential for helping customers choose:

**Electric Carts:**
• Lower operating costs
• Quieter operation
• Zero emissions
• Less maintenance
• Best for: Golf courses, gated communities, indoor use

**Gas Carts:**
• Longer range
• Faster refueling
• More power for hills
• Best for: Hunting, farming, long-distance use
commonMistakes: Pushing electric when gas is clearly a better fit
Not explaining total cost of ownership
Ignoring the customer's terrain and use environment
steps.whyItMatters: Matching the right cart type to the customer's needs prevents returns and builds long-term customer relationships.

steps.title: Customization Options
steps.instructions:
Our carts can be customized in many ways:

**Performance:**
• High-speed motors
• Lifted suspensions
• All-terrain tires

**Comfort:**
• Premium seats
• Weather enclosures
• Sound systems

**Utility:**
• Cargo beds
• Tow hitches
• Brush guards

**Aesthetics:**
• Custom paint
• Wheel packages
• LED lighting
commonMistakes: Not showing visual examples of customizations
Forgetting to explain lead times for custom orders
steps.whyItMatters: Customizations increase average order value and create unique products that customers love to show off.

steps.title: Warranty & Service
steps.instructions:
Every cart comes with comprehensive coverage:

**Standard Warranty:**
• 2-year bumper-to-bumper
• 5-year battery warranty (electric)
• 3-year drivetrain (gas)

**Extended Options:**
• Extended warranty packages
• Prepaid maintenance plans
• Roadside assistance

**Service Network:**
• On-site service available
• Factory-trained technicians
• Genuine parts guaranteed
commonMistakes: Not emphasizing warranty as a value-add
Failing to offer extended coverage at point of sale
Not explaining what's covered vs. not covered
steps.whyItMatters: Strong warranty coverage builds trust and differentiates us from competitors.

knowledgeChecks.question: Which type of cart is best for indoor use?
knowledgeChecks.explanation: Electric carts are ideal for indoor use because they produce zero emissions and operate quietly.

knowledgeChecks.question: What is included in the standard warranty for electric carts?
knowledgeChecks.explanation: Electric carts come with a 5-year battery warranty as part of the standard coverage.

knowledgeChecks.question: When should you recommend a gas cart over electric?
options: For hunting and long-distance off-road use
knowledgeChecks.explanation: Gas carts are better for hunting and long-distance use because they have longer range and faster refueling.
